thread.title: Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS
thread.title_full: Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS

title: Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS
text:
Kathy Willens Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS 
New York Mets' Travis d'Arnaud (7) greets Yoenis Cespedes (52) after Cespedes hit a fourth-inning, three-run home run during baseball's Game 3 of the National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Kathy Willens Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS 
New York Mets' Yoenis Cespedes takes a curtain call after hitting a three-run home run off Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Brett Anderson during the fourth inning of baseball's Game 3 of the National League Division Series Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Julie Jacobson Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS 
New York Mets pitcher Matt Harvey (33) delivers against the Los Angeles Dodgers during the first inning of baseball's Game 3 of the National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Julie Jacobson Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS 
Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Alex Wood (57) reacts after giving up a three-run home run to New York Mets' Yoenis Cespedes during the fourth inning of baseball's Game 3 of the National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Kathy Willens Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS 
New York Mets left fielder Yoenis Cespedes watches as center fielder Juan Lagares (12) can't reach Adrian Gonzalez's solo home run off Bartolo Colon in the seventh inning of baseball's Game 3 of the National League Division Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Kathy Willens Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS 
Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw (22) glances at Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley (26) as the crowd boos Utley during baseline introductions for baseball's Game 3 of the National League Division Series against the New York Mets, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in New York. Utley was disciplined for sliding hard into New York Mets' Ruben Tejada in Game 2, causing Tejada to break his leg. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Posted: Tuesday, October 13, 2015 12:25 am Granderson, Mets beat Dodgers 13-7, take 2-1 lead in NLDS   
NEW YORK (AP) â€” Curtis Granderson drove in five runs, Yoenis Cespedes homered into the second deck and the New York Mets overcame Matt Harvey's early struggles to beat the Los Angeles Dodgers 13-7 Monday night for a 2-1 lead in the NL Division Series. 
Travis d'Arnaud also homered as the Mets set a franchise postseason record for runs in their first playoff game at Citi Field. kAm|6ED C@@<:6 =67E\92?56C $E6G6? |2EK EC:6D E@ 4=@D6 @FE E96 D6C:6D %F6D52J ?:89E[ H96?
